title: Brunswick
content:
The person who sent me this sample said that it might be called 'Brunswick'. I didn't find anything in that vein. Any other suggestions?   
 ![Brunswick?](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19786.gif)
author: graficartist

comments.content: I haven't found the original yet, but [here's Ray Larabie's free knockoff](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552/http:/www.larabiefonts.com/fonts/a.html) of whatever it is.

Tom, you might check   
   
Comicraft   
Iconian   
Blambot
Yves, looing at you picture when does the fly go into your mouth. Just a joke
i combed all through those too. i'm glad yves double checked for me. i thought i might just be blind. i'll keep looking. thanks.
Yves! Everything falls into place--the username, the little photo--I had no idea there was a connection. Now I know.
Yves, I always knew you rocked, now I know why! Belt it out, Dan
But, do you have any connection with [them](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552/http:/www.troublemanunlimited.com/)?

I found this at dafont.com. It's close but not the same. The README file is a fascinating read for the history of the font. Perhaps the only time that the 'README' imperative has ever been justified. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
 ![Demonized - Greywolf WebWorks](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19903.gif)

Good thinking, BJ. I 'flipped' through the [Comicraft](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552/http:/www.comicbookfonts.com/)  
catalogue, but couldn't find it there.
... and not on [Iconian](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552/http:/www.iconian.com/). No such luck.

_\> Yves, looking at your picture when does the fly go   
into your mouth?_      
   
If I may quote Mr. Emmanuel Tzwern, singer and song   
provider of our rock band:   
"ADMIRE the human dynamo that is TROUBLEMAN's   
drummer Yves Peters as he knocks seven shades of $h!t   
out his poor old pitiful drumkit."   
   
 ![Troubleman_Rock Garden_21](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19841.gif)   
   
This picture was taken during the encores at our gig   
in London's Rock garden a couple of years ago. You're   
looking at unbridled rock'n'roll here. Now you know.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)   
   
PS My drum kit ain't really poor old and pitiful.

Hmmm... Now that I got "promoted" to head moderator of   
this place (which in fact means I now have to keep the   
Type ID Board clean all by myself), maybe it's time to   
look for a more dignified picture or symbol to represent   
myself. Black bow-tie anyone? Or should I use a monogram?   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Nope. I did stumble onto them when researching possible   
urls. We had to settle for [www.troubleman.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552/http:/www.troubleman.be/) _(no, there's   
nothing behind that link)_ . Someone's 'sitting' on the .com   
domain unfortunately.   
   
Here's a pic from the last promo shoot. I'm the one proudly   
wearing the California job case T-shirt. I'll post a more   
close-up one as soon as I've scanned the rest of the pictures.   
   
 ![Troubleman2003](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105104552im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19891.gif)
